SEARCH
Package SnakeGame

Class Unit

java.lang.Object
GameEngine.GameObject
SnakeGame.Unit
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRenderable, ISpatialComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
FoodSquare, SnakeUnit
public class Unit extends GameObject implements IRenderable, ISpatialComponent
Represents a unit: A square that holds a position, can be moved and can be rendered. To be sure the square is rendered with the same ammount of characters as it's size, the square is placed at a 1/2 offset from the grid, making it contain size * size integer values in the coordinate space As an example, a unit of of size 2 placed at (1.5,1.5) will contain the coordinates (1,1) (2,1) (1, 2) (2, 2) The unit must be placed in the appropriate position to hold that property. it's coordinates must end in .5 when the size is even and they must be a whole number when the size is odd
See Also:
  • Square
  • IRenderable
  • ISpatialComponent

    • Unit

      public Unit(Point position, double size, boolean isFilled, char drawChar, int layer) throws SnakeGameException
      Instantiates a unit. Same as
      invalid reference 
      Unit#Unit(Point,double,boolean,char,TerminalColour.Foreground,int)
      but with no colour.
      Throws:
      SnakeGameException

    • Unit

      public Unit(Point position, double size, boolean isFilled, char drawChar, TerminalColour.Foreground terminalColour, Color graphicalColor, int layer) throws SnakeGameException
      Instantiates a unit. Cannot use zero-based coordinates.
      Parameters:
      position - the position to instantiate the unit at (should end in .5 for even sizes, but otherwise is supported)
      size - the length of each side
      isFilled - if the unit should be filled
      drawChar - the character to draw the unit with
      terminalColour - the colour to draw the unit with on the terminal (can be null)
      graphicalColor - the colour to draw the unit with on the graphical interface (can be null)
      layer - the layer to draw the unit in
      Throws:
      SnakeGameException - if it's placed in an invalid position (including zero-based coordiantes)
